alert.note: Alert for City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, City of Hampton, City of Newport News, City of Poquoson and York. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Langley AFB, Hampton University, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Northampton, Beaconsdale, Tabb, Buckroe Beach, Fort Monroe, Grand View, Denbigh, Langley View, Hilton Village, Raleigh Terrace, Messick, Phoebus, Plum Tree Island Refuge and Oyster Point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; York
